name: Anant Vijay
review: This was different. Full disclosure-I'm an unapologetic John Grisham fan! I've randomly read many Grisham books. Recently, I decided to read the complete library in the order written.

name: Vasdev Mohi
review: This book became a pretty good movie. I read it years ago when I still bought every book this author wrote. This second read left me not nearly as satisfied. The story is good, it is just not presented as coherently as I remembered it.

name: Richard Powers
review: Dear Mr Grisham; Please consider writing another book about Mark and his family when Mark is in his twenties! What a great story it would be! I have been reading for 66 years and your book is on the very TOP of my list! Thanks, Collette Bills, Lincoln, Nebraska

name: Priyanka Chopra Jonas
review: I loved this book, and wish John Grisham would write a sequel; I would like to know what happens to the characters after the ending because they seemed so real to me. It is a book you will read more than once, and enjoy it every time.

name: Shakoor Rather
review: From the first few pages I was drawn in by this book, it was exceptional. Extremely well written and captivating and as a result of reading this I have since read every book by Julliane Hoffman. Her writing is superb and I would recommend all her titles. I hope that in future she publishes some more brillant titles.

name: Jokha Alharthi
review: normally am not interested in legal thrillers due to interpretation and understanding of legal matters, but being a human relations graduate student going into a therapy career, I was curious. Turns out I still don't care for reading about legalities; however, the parallelism of the protagonist's story to that of her counterpart was quite an interesting twist.
